dishes.name: Waakye
dishes.label: Hot
dishes.description: Waakye is a Ghanaian dish of cooked rice and beans, commonly eaten for breakfast or lunch. However, others eat it for supper. The rice and beans, usually black eyed peas or cow beans, are cooked together, along with red dried sorghum leaf sheaths or stalks and limestone.

dishes.name: Banku
dishes.description: Banku is a Ghanaian dish which is cooked by a proportionate mixture of fermented corn and cassava dough in hot water into a smooth, whitish paste, served with soup, okra stew or a pepper sauce with fish.

dishes.name: Jollof Rice
dishes.label: New
dishes.description: Jollof rice, or jollof, is a one-pot rice dish popular in many West African countries such as The Gambia, Senegal, Ghana, Nigeria, etc.

dishes.name: Black-eyed beans stew with rice
dishes.description: black-eyed beans stew with fried plantain, rice and garri.

promotions.name: Weekend Grand Buffet
promotions.label: New
promotions.description: Featuring mouthwatering combinations with a choice of five different ghanaian dishes, six enticing appetizers, six main entrees and five choicest desserts. Free flowing bubbly and soft drinks. All for just $19.99 per person

leaders.name: Peter Smith
leaders.description: Our CEO, Peter, credits his hardworking to his mother who's wizardy in the kitchen whipping up the tastiest dishes with whatever is available inexpensively at the supermarket, was his first inspiration to create the fusion cuisines for which The Frying Pan became well known. He brings his zeal for fusion cuisines to this restaurant, pioneering cross-cultural culinary connections.

leaders.name: Irfan Tahir
leaders.description: Our CFO, Irfan, as he is affectionately referred to by his colleagues, comes from a long established family tradition in farming and produce. His experiences growing up on a farm in the African outback gave him great appreciation for varieties of food sources. As he puts it in his own words, Everything that runs, wins, and everything that stays, pays!

leaders.name: Samuel Anabang
leaders.description: Blessed with the most discerning gustatory sense, Samuel, our CFO, personally ensures that every dish that we serve meets his exacting tastes. Our chefs dread the tongue lashing that ensues if their dish does not meet his exacting standards. He lives by his motto, You click only if you survive my lick.

leaders.name: Dawud Ibrahim Ismail
leaders.description: Award winning three-star Michelin chef with wide International experience having worked closely with whos-who in the culinary world, he specializes in creating mouthwatering African fusion experiences. He says, Put together the cuisines from multiple crazy cultures, and you get a winning hit!
